required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Brimonidine on Intraocular Pressure When Dilating Routine Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Brimonidine on Intraocular Pressure When Dilating Routine Patients, Pressure Control and Pupil Effects

brief_summary.textblock: This an interventional study looking at two different sequences of pre-operative eye drops, to determine which order is more effective in reducing intraocular pressure with pupil dilation.

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty healthy participants will be separated into two groups of 10 volunteers each. In both groups, the participant's right eye will serve as a control with only Tropicamide/phenylephrine given. In one group of 10 participants the left eyes will receive Alphagan prior to Tropicamide/phenylephrine. In the other group of 10 eyes, the left eyes will have Tropicamide/phenylephrine administered prior to Alphagan. The investigator will observe the intraocular benefits of the addition of Alphagan over the Tropicamide/phenylephrine alone and determine if pre-treating is any better than post-treating. In addition, the investigator will monitor pupil response, as it is known that Alphagan may have some effect on the pupil dilation.

study_design_info.masking_description: The PI measuring pupil size will not know the subject assignment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in intraocular pressure from baseline to 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 time points all occuring during one time visit: Baseline (pre drops), 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.
primary_outcome.description: Baseline (pre drops), 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pupil size pupil size from baseline to 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 time points all occuring during one time visit: Baseline (pre drops), 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline (pre drop), 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours. The investigator will measure the pupils under bright light conditions (photopic) and dim light conditions (scotopic)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pupil's reaction to light from baseline to 15 min after last drop given,30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 time points all occuring during one time visit: Baseline (pre drops), 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline (pre drop), 15 min after last drop given, 30 min, 1 hour, and 4 hours. Pupil reaction will be measure either as none, poor, or brisk.

arm_group.description: Alphagan plus group is one drop Brimonidine then, Tropicamide and Phenylephrine ophthalmic one drop,times one.
Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus intervention is one drop of each then Brimonidine one drop, times one.
Tropicamide and Phenylephrine only arm is given one drop of each times one.

intervention.description: Arm: Experimental: Alphagan plus Alphagan plus group is one drop Brimonidine then, Tropicamide and Phenylephrine ophthalmic one drop,times one. Arm: Experimental: Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus intervention is one drop of each then Brimonidine one drop, times one.

Arm: Experimental: Alphagan plus Alphagan plus group is one drop Brimonidine then, Tropicamide and Phenylephrine ophthalmic one drop,times one. Arm: Experimental: Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus intervention is one drop of each then Brimonidine one drop, times one. Arm: Active Comparator: Tropicamide and Phenylephrine only Tropicamide and Phenylephrine only arm is given one drop of each times one.

Arm: Experimental: Alphagan plus Alphagan plus group is one drop Brimonidine then, Tropicamide and Phenylephrine ophthalmic one drop,times one. Arm: Experimental: Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus Tropicamide and Phenylephrine plus intervention is one drop of each then Brimonidine one drop, times one. Arm: Active Comparator: Tropicamide and Phenylephrine only Tropicamide and Phenylephrine only arm is given one drop of each times one.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy with no major medical conditions. Contact lens wear is ok but must be not worn on the day of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic, history of glaucoma
- history of iris trauma
- history of eye surgery except LASIK or Photorefractive keratectomy laser eye surgery
- Anisocoria
- pregnancy

facility.name: Wake Forest Baptist Health Eye Center
